column4: hi everyone, does anyone know a (relatively simple) way to make HDMI audio output work with the Nvidia ION gfx?
audio output with graphics? That makes no sense.
its a HDMI output. HDMI carries both audio and video?
I wouldn't think a graphics output would be sending audio thought.
im not too sure, the HDMI out in my windows PC does sound & audio i jsut assumed the HDMI out on this ubuntu pc would also
i mean gfx and audio ;-)

Well, if it's a motherboard onboard output it might do, but if it's an output from a GPU it shouldn't have audio. Unless the card is some sort of audio/visual processor since it's for compact laptops (right?)
Are you audio settings configured to use that device and output for output?
What are you using to configure it?
The default pulse settings? Try installing pavucontrol, it might give you some better options. There's also an advanced ALSA configuration tool you could use instead but I can't recall the name.
